Part of the process of getting DIRECTV involves a necessary evil, a quick credit check (it’s a “soft pull” and takes about 30 seconds). Yeah, it’s annoying but it’s an important step for DIRECTV since they provide customers with a bunch of free equipment and dishes (not to mention the free installation). There’s no hard and fast number, but if your score is over 570, you probably won’t have to pay a deposit and will qualify for every promotion going. If you’re under 570, they may ask you to provide a deposit of anywhere from $50-$200, depending on the type of package and receiver you’re interested in. Keep in mind that’s a deposit not a fee so it’ll be applied to your upcoming bills. DIRECTV is simply looking for a bit of assurance and a deposit does just that
